Body: There's a number of other programs out there as well, but a lot have flaws. Having control over what you can search and what your outputs are is really useful, so you'll need to learn some regular expressions and a wee bit of coding (not much, I promise!). The Natural Language ToolKit can do this nicely if you're willing to learn a bit of python. I'd also recommend QCLWR but the learning curve is a bit higher for R than for python. R and python are both free, btw.
